metadata.Description: The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.

level 1.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.
Energy storage employs battery technologies to store and release energy efficiently, enabling the integration of renewable energy sources into the grid.
Energy storage collaborates with the electric vehicle industry to develop advanced battery technologies for electric vehicle charging and grid integration.
Energy storage supports grid stability by providing backup power and balancing supply and demand, especially during peak load periods.
Energy storage administers incentive programs to promote the adoption of energy storage systems and accelerate the transition to a clean energy future.
Energy storage measures the capacity of energy storage systems to assess their performance and optimize their utilization in the energy system.
Energy storage aligns with the goal of integrating renewable energy sources into the grid by providing a reliable and flexible energy storage solution.
Energy storage is an instance of the broader energy transition towards a more sustainable and resilient energy system.

subelement_relations.Description: Batteries are a type of energy storage technology that store electrical energy in chemical form. They are widely used in various applications, including renewable energy integration, electric vehicles, and grid stabilization.
Flywheels are mechanical devices that store rotational energy. They are used for short-duration energy storage and provide fast response times for grid stabilization and frequency regulation.

Compressed air energy storage (CAES) is a method of storing energy by compressing air and storing it in underground caverns or tanks. It is used for large-scale energy storage and can provide grid stability and peak shaving.

Pumped hydro storage is a form of hydroelectric energy storage that uses two reservoirs at different elevations to store and generate electricity. It is a mature and widely deployed technology for grid-scale energy storage.

Thermal energy storage (TES) systems store thermal energy in the form of hot or cold fluids or materials. They are used for heating, cooling, and power generation applications, enabling efficient energy use and demand management.
